results.name: a(n) = floor(sigma(n)/n).
comment: First occurrence of k: 1,6,120,27720,..., which is A023199. - _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 28 2005
a(n) > 1 if n is perfect or abundant. a(n) = 2 if n is perfect or primitive abundant (see A091191). - _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 06 2012
reference: W. Sierpinski, Elementary Theory of Numbers, 1987, p. 174 ff.
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[ Floor[ DivisorSigma[1, n]/n], {n, 105}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 28 2005 *)
program: a108775 n = div (a000203 n) n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2013
